Package frc.robot.subsystems

Class Hopper

  • java.lang.Object
    • frc.robot.subsystems.Hopper
  • public class Hopper
extends java.lang.Object
    The Hopper subsystem consists of 3 motors to move the power cells in stages. The bottom of the hopper is not indexed, and can hold three balls. They then transition into the tower, where they are indexed using 3 individual sensors.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Hopper getInstance​(boolean compBot)
        Returns a singular instance of the Intake subsystem.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the belt and feeder motors.

      • update

        public void update()
        Indexes hopper.

      • reverse

        public void reverse​(double speed)
        called when the driver is ready to shoot (pushing the button on the controller) sets the belt speed to the tested value necessary to feed

      • forward

        public void forward​(boolean atTarget)
        Called when the driver is ready to shoot. Doesn't index balls until shooterAtSpeed argument is true, meaning the shooter has spun up.
        Parameters:
        shooterAtSpeed - whether the shooter is at target RPM

      • forwardShot

        public void forwardShot​(boolean atTarget)
        An experimental shooting method which ignores top sensor logic as an attempt to increase indexing speed. TODO: needs testing.
        Parameters:
        atTarget - whether the shooter is at its target

      • shootNoLogic

        public void shootNoLogic()
        Runs the hopper without logic. Avoid using this.

      • readyToShoot

        public boolean readyToShoot()
        Determine whether we are in a state where shooting is possible.
